articles.title: New Remedies Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Remedies Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- New kinds of remedies have been developed at public health institutions of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Kim Man Yu Hospital invented a method of washing intestinal canal in a shorter time and a new way of endoscopy capable of diagnosing colon cancer in its early stage and established a new standard of differential diagnosis.
					
					 The Pyongyang Maternity Hospital applied vasography to treatment of gynecopathy. Its application is considered effective in recovering female disorder.
					
					 The Tumour Institute of the Academy of Medical Science developed a new kind of anti-cancer medicine.

articles.title: Many Local, International Sports Events to Be Held This Year
articles.content:
Many Local, International Sports Events to Be Held This Year
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Many local and international sports events will be held this significant year.
					 They include sports contests for Paektusan Prize and Mangyongdae Prize marking the Day of the Shining Star, birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, and the Day of the Sun, birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, Pochonbo Torch Prize, Jonsung Cup and Osandok Prize as well as the 16th National Taekwon-Do Championship for Jongilbong Prize.
					
					 In February and April the 22nd Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival, the IAAF-the 26th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon and others are to be held.
					
					 Colorful mass sports games are also expected.
					
					 The 18th Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions and the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest among officials of organs in the city will be held. The workers' sports contest in the field of coal mining industry and national workers' sports contest, basketball games of officials of national institutions and other sports contests are to be held.
					
					 Korean athletes will take part in international events to be held in different areas of the world.
					
					 They will participate in the 6th East Asia Contest, the U-19 women's football, marathon, wrestling and judo tournaments and youth and juvenile weight-lifting championships.
					
					 Drawing the attention of the experts and amateurs are championships and contests including world championships of table tennis, wrestling, weight-lifting and swimming as well as world cup contests of gymnastics, archery, judo and shooting and international track-and-field meet.

articles.title: Slogan Encouraging Patriotism
articles.content:
Slogan Encouraging Patriotism
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- "Let Us Study for Korea!" serves as a patriotic slogan that the Korean people should hold high in the present times, the era of knowledge-based economy.
					 The slogan was set forth by leader Kim Jong Il 60 years ago when he was studying at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, an educational institution for the children of revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 During his days at the school, he paid close attention to raising the students' zeal for study so that they could gain knowledge instrumental to the Korean revolution.
					
					 In January Juche 42 (1953) he advanced the slogan "Let Us Study for Korea!" at a sub-branch meeting of the Children's Union, saying the slogan carries the idea that all students should acquire more practical knowledge to further glorify Korea as faithful sons and daughters of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He stressed the need for them to follow the revolutionary idea of the President and get a good understanding of Korea's history, geography and culture as well as of the country's situation.
					
					 Since then, the slogan had stirred up the school youth and children's enthusiasm for study and brought good results in their school course. It also encouraged the working people to study hard for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Displaying its great vitality, the slogan is still inspiring the army and people of the DPRK to dynamically advance toward the high eminence of a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's 1 000-ri Journey for National Liberation
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's 1 000-ri Journey for National Liberation
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Eighty-eight years has passed since President Kim Il Sung set out on 1 000-ri (250-mile) journey for national liberation at the age of 14.
					 Earlier, in March Juche 12 (1923), Kim Il Sung made 1 000-ri journey for learning from Badaogou of China to Korea to study in the homeland. It was a few months ahead of his graduation from Changdok School in Korea when he heard the news that his father, Kim Hyong Jik, was arrested again by the Japanese police.
					
					 So, he embarked on the long journey with a firm determination to liberate the country from the Japanese invaders.
					
					 More than half of the areas along the road for the journey were uninhabited and its course was woven with steep ridges and snow-covered high hills and mountains
					
					 At last he reached the Phophyong Ferry in Korea-China border area late on the afternoon of the 13th day of the arduous journey.
					
					 Then he began to cross the River Amnok bordering China, singing the "Song of the River Amnok". He looked back at the mountains in the homeland, occupied by the Japanese imperialist aggressors, over and again with sorrow and indignation. Picturing in his mind the miserable situation of the homeland, he made a grim resolve not to return before Korea became independent.
					
					 This determination was prompted by his ardent patriotism to retake Korea on any account.

articles.title: Phophyong, Second Hometown to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Phophyong, Second Hometown to Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- There is the Phophyong Revolutionary Site in Kim Hyong Jik County, Ryanggang Province in the northern part of Korea.
					 It is the place where President Kim Il Sung crossed the River Amnok to embark on the road of revolution at the age of 14, with a firm pledge that he would not return home unless he liberated Korea from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Recalling the day, Kim Il Sung in his reminiscences "With the Century" said:
					
					 "I thought: My dear Korea, I am leaving you. I know I cannot live even for a moment away from you, but I am crossing the Amnok to win you back. Across this river is a foreign land, but I will not forget you, even in there. Wait for me, my Korea. 
					
					 Then I sang the song of the River Amnok again."
					
					 At the site there are a statue portraying Kim Il Sung crossing the River Amnok, the Phophyong revolutionary museum, etc. 
					
					 One day in July Juche 77 (1988), the President told officials that Phophyong was his second hometown.
					
					 When visiting Phophyong in September 1991, he sang the "Song of the River Amnok" together with officials and lecturers, looking back on the days when he made the 1 000-ri (250-mile) journey for national liberation.
					
					 The site also has the Monument to the Phophyong Revolutionary Site, which tells about the revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung and the feats of his family members who devoted their all to the freedom of the people and the liberation of Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Unity of Whole Nation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Unity of Whole Nation
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- It is a sure guarantee for accomplishing the cause of national reunification to achieve the unity of the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification which had made dynamic advance in the spirit of "By our nation itself" clearly proves that no one can match the concerted efforts of the Korean nation, and they provide a sure guarantee for the victory in the national reunification movement.
					
					 The might of national unity had been more strikingly demonstrated in the June 15 era of reunification than in any other times.
					
					 "By our nation itself", the main spirit of the June 15 era of reunification, is an idea of national independence and, at the same time, an idea of national unity. After the publication of the June 15 joint declaration all Koreans had waged a strenuous struggle for achieving independent reunification through national unity, cherishing the idea of "By our nation itself." In this course the great national unity was put on a new historical phase. There is nothing impossible and independent reunification is quite attainable when Koreans join hands and pool their efforts. This truth has been enshrined in the hearts of all Koreans as firm faith.
					
					 Without the unity of the nation, the independent and peaceful reunification of the country would be unthinkable. The wisdom, will and strength of the united nation constitute a driving force to usher in a new morning of independent reunification.
					
					 No matter what different needs and interests individual class and stratum in the nation may seek, they can hardly be bigger than the common requirements and interests of the nation. When the Koreans place such common interests as national reunification above anything else, they can certainly achieve the unity of the nation irrespective of ideology and social system.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Rejects Imperialists' Interference in Internal Affairs of Other Countries
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Rejects Imperialists' Interference in Internal Affairs of Other Countries
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Different countries of the world aspiring after independence and progress should heighten vigilance against the imperialists' moves, solve their issues in line with their common interests and thus contribute to achieving regional and global peace and development, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists are working hard to drive a wedge among tribes and religious sets in a state in a bid to sow the seeds of split and discord among them and pit them against one another, prompted by their interests.
					
					 They escalate confrontation and dispute by giving backing and "aid" to one force in a country and putting pressure on other force and exploit this as a pretext for interfering in its internal affairs.
					
					 Imperialists term any forces obedient to them "liberal democratic forces", "protector of human rights" and "justice" but brand any forces as "dictator", "terrorist organization" and "human rights abusers" if they fail to do so. They are bound to become a target of imperialists. This is preposterous logic, indeed.
					
					 These moves of the imperialists spark off disputes among tribes and religious sets in some countries, creating complicated situations.
					
					 History goes to prove that failure to maintain vigilance against the imperialists' moves for division and alienation and take precautionary measures against them will entail serious consequences. 
					
					 One should not pin any hope on the remedy offered by imperialists. Their remedy is not for a country and nation. This is entirely aimed to whitewash them as a guardian of peace and fish in troubled waters.
					
					 The imperialists are openly interfering in the internal affairs of other countries by poking their nose into their disputes under the signboard of "mediator." Finally, they hurl their forces for aggression and establish military bases under the pretext of "peace-keeping."
					
					 Those dispute-torn countries should reject the imperialists' remedy and achieve unity and weather difficulties by their own remedy in line with common requirements and interests. This is the only solution to the issues.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Attempt at Biased Settlement of Personnel Affair
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Attempt at Biased Settlement of Personnel Affair
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps held a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 17 denouncing the "government" authorities for their attempt at a biased solution to a personnel affair.
					 At the press conference speakers accused the authorities of trying to appoint Ri Tong Hup as chief justice of the Constitutional Court.
					
					 At the trial calling into question the irresponsibility of the authorities who remained a passive onlooker to a solution to the issue related to sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army in 2011, Ri called for turning down the case, insisting that it is impossible to force anything on the regime for the mere reason that it was urgently  demanded by people, they noted. He also opposed the decision of the Constitutional Court that it is unconstitutional that the regime failed to make efforts for a solution to the above-said issue.
					
					 They exposed what he has done as a judge at the Constitutional Court including his opposition to a special law on confiscating properties of pro-Japanese elements in 2011.
					
					 Ri is not qualified to become chief justice of the Constitutional Court as he has disregarded the demand of the victims of the sexual slavery, they said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Dynamic Leadership Introduced by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Dynamic Leadership Introduced by Foreign Media 
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers and websites devoted special write-ups to praising the greatness of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un illustrated with his portrait and photos on his revolutionary activities. 
					 The Iranian paper Iran News on Jan. 7 dedicated a whole page to articles under the caption "Rosy future of Songun Korea led by Marshal Kim Jong Un".
					
					 The paper said Kim Jong Un has performed most distinguished exploits in political, economic, military, cultural and all other fields over the past one year which no one could ever do, adding that he is drawing great attention from the world as the days go by. 
					
					 The Mongolian paper Zuuny Medee on Jan. 7 carried an article titled "For a final victory" which said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his speech at a parade in celebration of the 100th Day of the Sun in April last year appealed: "Forward for a final victory!"
					
					 The DPRK has already emerged a political and ideological power and a military power and it is now waging a dynamic drive to build an economic power. 
					
					 The Indian paper New Delhi Times on Jan. 8 carried an article titled "Leader who loves future". It said:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's ceaseless field guidance to every nook and corner of the country is drawing great attention of world media. Everybody is attracted by him talking to people freely and earnestly in a self-possessed manner. 
					
					 What impresses people in particular is that he shows deep love for the younger generation. 
					
					 Articles praising the personality of Kim Jong Un as a great man were posted on the websites of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK on Jan. 7 and 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Praised at Seminar in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Praised at Seminar in Germany 
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the subject of "Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Un" took place in Berlin on Jan. 12. 
					 Present at the seminar were figures of political parties and organizations and followers of the Juche idea in Germany.
					
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chief of the German Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il, said:
					
					 Last year was a significant year when the Korean people left big traces in the work to glorify the revolutionary exploits of leader Kim Jong Il for all ages under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The Korean people successfully carried out the behests of Kim Jong Il by launching a satellite in the run-up to the first anniversary of his demise. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address set forth the tasks to bring about a radical turn in the building of an economic giant with the same spirit and mettle as were displayed in conquering space. 
					
					 The West will see again the DPRK prove the justice of its cause in practice this year. 
					
					 The chief of the Hannover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his lifetime unrolled a plan for building a thriving nation and laid solid foundations for it.
					
					 The Korean people set a higher goal with redoubled efforts and are working hard to attain it despite the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK. 
					
					 The launch of satellite is part of their efforts. 
					
					 The New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un evoked lively response among international public circles. 
					
					 I hope the Korean people will certainly implement the tasks set forth in the New Year Address under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A message to him was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: DPRK's Call for Dissolution of "UN Command" Favored by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Call for Dissolution of "UN Command" Favored by Foreign Organizations 
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign organizations made public a joint statement and statements in support of the memorandum of the DPRK Foreign Ministry urging the U.S. to dissolve the "UN Command" in south Korea. 
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a joint statement on Jan. 14 said that the "UN Command" in south Korea is a U.S "tool" which has nothing to do with the UN.
					
					 The DPRK proposed the U.S. to replace the Armistice Agreement with a permanent peace agreement, but the U.S. deliberately disregarded it, the joint statement said, adding:
					
					 The UN General Assembly in 1975 adopted two resolutions on the dissolution of the "UN Command", but the U.S. shunned its obligation contrary to the unanimous desire of the international community and world people.
					
					 The U.S. scenario to turn the ghostlike "UN Command" into a "multinational forces command" is intended to knock into shape an alliance for stifling socialist Korea of Juche by force of arms and expand its domination and influence upon the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to steadily bolster up its war deterrence. 
					
					 The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and the Bangladesh Group for the Study of Songun Policy made public statements on Jan. 16 in which they held the dissolution of the "UN Command" is an inevitable requirement for protecting peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: Dissolution of "UN Command" Demanded by Socialist Party of Benin
articles.content:
Dissolution of "UN Command" Demanded by Socialist Party of Benin
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Benin released a statement on January 16 demanding the dissolution of the "UN Command".
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. has persistently maintained cease-fire while defying the consistent stand and efforts of the DPRK government to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace accord. The "UN Command", ghost of the Cold War, is behind the U.S. moves.
					
					 For the U.S. to maintain the "UN Command" or not is directly linked with the issue of whether to keep the tool for a war of aggression in the Asia-Pacific region, the biggest hotspot of the world, or not.
					
					 Today it has become clear that the "UN Command" no longer serves as a tool under the jurisdiction of the UN but has become a war tool for the U.S.
					
					 It should be dissolved at once so as to recover the authority and the fairness of the UN and replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace accord.
					
					 The Socialist Party of Benin urges the U.S. to immediately dissolve the "UN Command" and give up the hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 The party wishes the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people success in the struggle to solve the above said problems this year marking the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War, and extends full support and solidarity to them.

articles.title: U.S. Fears DPRK's Development of Technology: Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Fears DPRK's Development of Technology: Brazilian Organization 
						
 Pyongyang, January 22 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on Jan. 15 posted on its website an article titled "The U.S. fears development of technology of socialist Korea" with a photo of the launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2. 
					 It said as follows:
					
					 The U.S. killed a lot of Koreans with all kinds of bombs including napalm bombs during the Korean War from June 25, 1950 to July 27, 1953. 
					
					 Under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung the Korean people won a historic victory after beating the U.S. forces in the war. 
					
					 After the war the U.S. tried to perpetuate the division of Korea and turned south Korea into its military base and a huge arsenal of arms for aggression including nuclear weapons.
					
					 Today the U.S. warmongers are getting evermore undisguised in the moves for invasion of the DPRK. 
					
					 These days the U.S. is running amuck in war drills to invade the DPRK while kicking up anti-DPRK moves after the latter's independent satellite launch. 
					
					 The DPRK has strong nuclear deterrence and modern offensive and defensive means. The U.S. fears the development of technology of socialist Korea.

articles.title: Logran en la RPDC exitos que contribuyen al desarrollo de salud publica
articles.content:
Logran en la RPDC exitos que contribuyen al desarrollo de salud publica
						
Pyongyang, 22 de enero (ACNC) -- Los funcionarios sanitarios de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea alcanzan exitos que contribuyen al fomento de salud publica. 
					El Hospital Kim Man Yu en esta capital sobresale en el tratamiento de las enfermedades de intestino grueso. 
					
					Perfecciono el metodo de tratamiento urgente antes del examen medico, el de endoscopio y el de diagnosis y tratamiento del cancer de intestino grueso. 
					
					Los galenos de la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang introducen nueva tecnologia que permite rehabilitar a las pacientes, que padecen de graves enfermedades ginecologicas, inclusive la infertilidad.
					
					El Instituto de Tumor adscrito a la Academia de Ciencias Medicas desarrollo nuevo medicamento anti-cancer y a base de este logro, estudian otras sustancias anticancerosas.

articles.title: Juegos nacionales e internacionales programados para este ano
articles.content:
Juegos nacionales e internacionales programados para este ano
						
Pyongyang, 22 de enero (ACNC) -- Tendran lugar este ano muchos juegos nacionales e internacionales.
					Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero) y el Dia del Sol (15 de abril), se inauguraran las competencias deportivas por las copas Paektusan y Mangyongdae, y seguidamente los juegos por las copas Antorcha de Pochombo y Osandok, el XVI campeonato nacional de Taekwondo por la Copa Jongilbong y otros torneos y campeonatos nacionales.
					
					Se efectuaran en febrero y abril el 22o festival internacional de patinaje artistico sobre el hielo por el premio Paektusan, el 26o torneo internacional de maraton para el premio Mangyongdae como evento concurrente de la Federacion Internacional de Atletas Amateurs (FIAA) y otros juegos.
					
					Tambien se desplegaran activamente diversos torneos de masas, por ejemplo la 18a competencia deportiva por la copa Paektusan de los funcionarios de los organos centrales y el torneo por la copa Mangyongdae de los funcionarios de los organos a nivel de ciudad, la competencia deportiva de los obreros del sector de la industria carbonifera y el torneo nacional de trabajadores y la competencia de baloncesto de los funcionarios de los organos centrales.
					
					Los jugadores coreanos tambien tomaran parte en las competencias internacionales que tendran lugar en varias regiones del mundo.
					
					Participaran en 6o Torneo de Asia Oriental, la competencia de futbol femenino sub-19, maraton, lucha, judo y el campeonato de levantamiento de pesas de juniores.
					
					Ya acaparan la peculiar atencion de los especialistas y aficionados los campeonatos y competencias por disciplinas.
